meanings.definition: A class of organic compounds containing a bicyclic structure with two benzene rings fused together.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the properties of various indenes in the lab.
meanings.sent2: Indenes are commonly found in certain types of organic chemistry textbooks.
meanings.sent3: The indenes at the party were always the center of attention with their unique structure.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a complex web of indenes, each thought interconnected and fused together.
meanings.sent5: The indenes in the painting seemed to jump out at the viewer, creating a sense of depth and complexity.

meanings.definition: A specific compound within the indene class, typically used in the production of plastics and resins.
meanings.sent1: The factory produced large quantities of indenes for the manufacturing industry.
meanings.sent2: Indenes play a crucial role in the creation of durable plastic materials.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous indenes in the warehouse always found a way to stick to everything!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like indenes, molding and shaping the world around her.
meanings.sent5: The indenes in the formula gave the resin its unique strength and flexibility.
